content: graft the toe closed turn sock inside out and darn in all loose threads work a second sock the same way but feel free to play with the colours if you fancy further options - as i said before the number of colours used is up to you you could also keep all triangles going in one direction in a main colour and only have the triangles going in the other direction changing their colours this would probably look closer to the flying geese quilting pattern - depending on the length of the leg and the foot your cuff heel and toe could all be different colours if you like them to be the same make sure that 5 rounds before the heel and the toe you introduce your chosen colour into the pattern - of course you can easily substitute other types of heels and toes if you prefer for a short row heel omit all the gusset instructions and just continue working the charts in the round straight after the heel glossary st sts stitch stitches k knit p purl sl slip k2tog knit 2 stitches together ssk slip slip knit slip 2 stitches separately as if to knit insert left needle into these two stitches from the right and knit onto right needle p2tog purl 2 stitches together gander page 5 gander page 6
